Pacific Islands need to boost digital security to join undersea cable, says US officialPacific Islands nations that want to connect to U.S.-funded undersea cables will need to secure their digital ecosystems to guard against data risks from China, a senior U.S. State Department official said. Wed, 31 Jan 2024 03:17:37 GMT GR5VS2UI2VNA5NIBF4YTBYGAFM https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/pacific-islands-need-boost-digital-security-join-undersea-cable-says-us-official-2024-01-31/Kirsty Needham世界亚太地区
Asia stocks head for monthly loss as China drags; FOMC loomsAsian shares fell broadly on Wednesday, while the Australian dollar slid after surprisingly soft domestic inflation data and short-dated Treasury yields stayed elevated ahead of a rate decision from the Federal Reserve. IMF sees improved prospects for soft landing in Asian economiesAsian central banks may see scope to loosen monetary policy later this year as inflation moderates, heightening prospects for a soft landing in the region's economies, the International Monetary Fund said on Wednesday. Wed, 31 Jan 2024 02:19:35 GMT VGD3WUUYFNK57MBADTTZ64QPAY https://www.reuters.com/markets/asia/imf-sees-improved-prospects-soft-landing-asian-economies-2024-01-31/Leika Kihara市场亚洲市场
China's factory activity shrinks again, weak demand hobbles economyChina's manufacturing activity contracted for the fourth straight month in January, an official factory survey showed on Wednesday, suggesting the sprawling sector and the broader economy were struggling to regain momentum at the start of 2024. Heavy fog suspends shipping at Chinese ports; Shanghai issues heightened advisoryHeavy fog has suspended the operation of ships travelling through the Qiongzhou Strait off the coast of China's Guangdong province and several cities, including Shanghai, have issued warning advisories, Chinese state media reported on Wednesday. US needs to work with greater intensity in the Pacific - NZ foreign ministerNew Zealand will start talks on Wednesday with Australia about cooperating with the AUKUS trilateral defence partnership between, Foreign Minister Winston Peters said, adding Washington needed to do more in the Pacific to counter other political influences there. Dollar eyes monthly gain as markets look to FedThe dollar headed for its biggest monthly gain since September and the yen for its sharpest drop in nearly a year on Wednesday, as traders waited on a U.S. rates decision to round out January. Wed, 31 Jan 2024 00:50:59 GMT GLIYMXEJDROSVFZFCJTQ4VCUMM https://www.reuters.com/markets/currencies/dollar-eyes-monthly-gain-market-look-fed-2024-01-31/Tom Westbrook市场货币
Taiwan angered at 'unilateral' China change to Taiwan Strait flight pathTaiwan's government expressed anger after China "unilaterally" changed a flight path close to the sensitive median line in the Taiwan Strait, saying it appeared to be a deliberate attempt to change the status quo for possible military means. EU trade chief to press on with US battery minerals talks despite differencesThe U.S. and European Union failed on Tuesday to reach a trade deal for critical battery minerals but are vowing to press ahead with talks to create a transtlantic marketplace for minerals and other components, the EU's top trade official said on Tuesday.
